alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 4:05PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Okeechobee, Indian River, south central Brevard and southeastern Osceola Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 404 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fellsmere. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Sebastian, Fellsmere, Barefoot Bay and Blue Cypress Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Coastal Indian River; Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Okeechobee; Osceola
